Theron::Actor::Actor (  )  [inline]

Default constructor.

Actor classes can be instantiated using the CreateActor methods of a Framework object, which returns an ActorRef object referencing the created actor. The created actor can't be accessed directly. Instead it is referenced in user code by ActorRef objects, which are copyable, lightweight references to the actor. ActorRef objects are like conventional references and can be copied, assigned, passed by value or reference, and returned by value from functions.

    class MyActor : public Theron::Actor
    {
    };

    Theron::Framework framework;
    Theron::ActorRef myActor = framework.CreateActor<MyActor>();

A powerful feature of actors is that they can create other actors, allowing the building of complex subsystems of actors using object-like abstraction. See the documentation of the GetFramework method for more information.

Note:
Only the Framework can construct actors.
